translated: Cessation not due to deliberation is the cessation of future entities not yet come to birth, which is not due to deliberation.üîΩFor example, when a person has a strong desire for a certain form, the five collections of consciousness that have that form, sound, smell, taste, and tangible for their objects are unable to arise.

original: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i mthu med do //
analyzed: de dag 'das pa'i yul la dmigs pa'i mthu med do //
translated: For these five collections of consciousness do not have the power to take the past object as their object-support.

original: de'i phyir de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa de ni rkyen ma tshang bas 'thob bo //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag gi so sor brtags pa ma yin pa'i 'gog pa de ni rkyen ma tshang bas 'thob bo //
translated: Consequently, their cessation not due to deliberation is obtained through the absence of conditions.

original: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas rnam pa gsum bshad zin to //
translated: The three unconditioned things have been discussed.

original: lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams zag bcas zhes gang smras ba la /
analyzed: lam ma gtogs pa'i 'dus byas rnams zag bcas zhes gang smras ba la /

analyzed: 'dus byas de dag gang zhe na // 'dus byas pa'i chos de yang //

original: gzugs sogs phung po lnga po ste /
analyzed: gzugs sogs phung po lnga po ste /
translated: The conditioned factors are the five aggregates, matter, etc.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / tshor ba'i phung po dang / 'du shes kyi phung po dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dang / rnam par shes pa'i phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of matter, the aggregate of sensation, the aggregate of ideation, the aggregate of the formations, the aggregate of consciousness.

original: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams te rkyen rnams kyis 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa ni 'dus byas rnams so //üîΩde nyid dus dang gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhir bcas dang // de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
analyzed: de dag ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams te rkyen rnams kyis 'dus shing phrad nas byas pa ni 'dus byas rnams so //üîΩde nyid dus dang gtam gzhi dang // nges par 'byung bcas gzhir bcas dang // de nyid ces bya ba ni 'dus byas kyi chos rnams so //
translated: The conditioned factors are the factors which are produced through the coming together of causes and conditions.üîΩThey are the five aggregates, with the exception of the pure factors, i.e., the factors of the path, and the three unconditioned factors.üîΩThe conditioned factors are the five aggregates, with the exception of the pure factors, i.e., the factors of the path, and the three unconditioned factors.

original: song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: song ba dang 'gro ba dang 'gro bar 'gyur pa'i phyir ram /

original: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zos pa'i phyir dus so //
analyzed: mi rtag pa nyid kyis zos pa'i phyir dus so //

original: gtam ni ngag go //
analyzed: gtam ni ngag go //

original: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /
analyzed: de'i gzhi ni ming ste /

analyzed: de 'di dag la yod pas nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa dag go //

analyzed: 'thab pa ni nyon mongs pa rnams te /

analyzed: mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dang / lce dang / lus su rig par bya'o //

analyzed: dbang po lnga rnams bshad zin to //

translated: What are the elements that are the basis of noninformative form?

original: 'byung ba dag ni sa'i khams dang / chu dang me dang rlung khams rnams so //
analyzed: 'byung ba dag ni sa'i khams dang / chu dang me dang rlung khams rnams so //
translated: The elements are the earth element, the water element, the fire element, and the wind element.

original: de ltar na khams bzhi po de dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na khams bzhi po de dag ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams zhes bya'o //
translated: Thus, these four elements are called the four great elements.

original: yang khams de dag gi las ni cir grub rang bzhin ni ci zhe na /
analyzed: yang khams de dag gi las ni cir grub rang bzhin ni ci zhe na /
translated: What is the function of these elements? What is their intrinsic nature?

original: smras pa / 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub //üîΩ'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin pa dang / rgyas pa ste /üîΩlas 'di rnams ni /
analyzed: smras pa / 'dzin pa la sogs las su grub // 'dzin pa dang / sdud pa dang / smin pa dang / rgyas pa ste / las 'di rnams ni /
translated: They are established as the function of support, etc.üîΩThe function of the earth element is support; the function of the water element is cohesion; the function of the fire element is maturation; the function of the wind element is distension.

original: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams de dag gi las su go rims bzhin du grub bo //
analyzed: sa dang / chu dang / me dang / rlung gi khams de dag gi las su go rims bzhin du grub bo //
translated: These functions are established in the order in which the elements are enumerated.

original: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
analyzed: rang bzhin ni go rims bzhin du /
translated: What is their intrinsic nature?

original: sa dang gsher dro g-yo ba rnams //
analyzed: sa dang gsher dro g-yo ba rnams //
translated: They are solidity, liquidity, heat, and motion.

original: sa'i khams ni sra ba'o //
analyzed: sa'i khams ni sra ba'o //
translated: The earth element is solidity.

original: chu'i khams ni gsher ba'o //
analyzed: chu'i khams ni gsher ba'o //
translated: The water element is liquidity.

original: me'i khams ni dro ba nyid do //
analyzed: me'i khams ni dro ba nyid do //
translated: The fire element is heat.

original: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams ni g-yo ba'o //
translated: The wind element is motion.

original: sa la sogs pa dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
analyzed: sa la sogs pa dang / sa'i khams la sogs pa la bye brag ci zhig yod ce na /
translated: What is the difference between earth, etc., and the earth element, etc.?

original: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad kyis //
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi ni tha snyad kyis //
translated: Earth, etc., are conventionally known.

original: kha dog dbyibs las sa zhes brjod //
analyzed: kha dog dbyibs las sa zhes brjod //
translated: Earth is conventionally known as color and shape.

original: 'di ltar sa ston pa na re kha dog dang / dbyibs la ston to //
analyzed: 'di ltar sa ston pa na re kha dog dang / dbyibs la ston to //
translated: The earth element is indicated by its color and shape.

original: sa la ji lta bar chu dang me yang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis kha dog dang dbyibs nyid las brjod do //üîΩrlung khams nyid /
analyzed: sa la ji lta bar chu dang me yang 'jig rten pa'i tha snyad kyis kha dog dang dbyibs nyid las brjod do // rlung khams nyid /
translated: In the same way, the water element and the fire element are indicated by their color and shape, in accordance with ordinary language.üîΩThe wind element is indicated by its motion.

original: rlung gi khams nyid gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten dag na rlung zhes 'dogs so //üîΩde lta mod kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis kha dogs dang dbyibs las zhes brjod pa de bzhin du /üîΩrlung la yang rlung sngon po'o //
analyzed: rlung gi khams nyid gang yin pa de nyid la 'jig rten dag na rlung zhes 'dogs so // de lta mod kyi 'jig rten gyi tha snyad kyis kha dogs dang dbyibs las zhes brjod pa de bzhin du / rlung la yang rlung sngon po'o //
translated: The wind element is indicated by its motion, in accordance with ordinary language.üîΩBut, in ordinary language, one says that the wind is blue, that it blows from the east, etc.

original: rlung zlum po'o zhes brjod do //
analyzed: rlung zlum po'o zhes brjod do //
translated: In the same way, one says that the wind is cold or hot, that it blows from the east, the south, etc.

original: 'byung ba chen po dag bshad zin to //üîΩgang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin smras pa de dag nyid //
analyzed: 'byung ba chen po dag bshad zin to // gang dag gzugs kyi phung po'i rang bzhin smras pa de dag nyid //
translated: The great elements have been discussed.üîΩThe aggregates, sense spheres and elements have been discussed in the chapter on the aggregates.üîΩThe sense faculties and objects are the same as the elements.

original: dbang po don rnams de nyid la //üîΩskye mched khams dag bcur 'dod do //
analyzed: dbang po don rnams de nyid la // skye mched khams dag bcur 'dod do //
translated: The sense faculties and objects are the same as the elements.

original: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu dag ste /
analyzed: skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni skye mched bcu dag ste /
translated: The sense spheres are the same as the sense faculties and objects.

original: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi skye mched dang / gzugs kyi skye mched nas lus kyi skye mched dang reg bya'i skye mched kyi bar du'o //
translated: The sense-sphere of the eye, the sense-sphere of visible form, up to the sense-sphere of the body and the sense-sphere of the tangible.

original: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni khams bcu dag ste /
analyzed: khams rnam par gzhag pa ni khams bcu dag ste /
translated: The elements are established as ten elements:

original: mig gi khams nas /
analyzed: mig gi khams nas /
translated: the element of the eye,

original: gzugs kyi khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi khams dang / lus kyi khams dang / reg bya'i khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: the element of visible form, up to the element of the body and the element of the tangible.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / de'i skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / de'i skye mched dang / khams rnam par gzhag pa bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregate of form, its sense-sphere and its element have been explained.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now feeling, etc. should be mentioned.

original: de la tshor ba myong ba ste /
analyzed: de la tshor ba myong ba ste /
translated: Among them, feeling is experience.

original: bde @99a * //
analyzed: bde @99a * //
translated: Pleasant,

original: ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor pa'i phung po'o //
analyzed: ba dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / bde ba yang ma yin sdug bsngal ba yang ma yin pa myong ba rnam pa gsum ni tshor pa'i phung po'o //
translated: unpleasant, and neither pleasant nor unpleasant experience is the aggregate of feeling.

original: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
analyzed: 'du shes ni mtshan mar 'dzin pa'i bdag nyid de /
translated: Perception is the nature of grasping a sign.

original: gang sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / mdza' bo dang / dgra dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa 'di ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gang sngon po dang / ser po dang / ring po dang / thung ngu dang / skyes pa dang / bud med dang / mdza' bo dang / dgra dang / bde ba dang / sdug bsngal la sogs pa'i mtshan mar 'dzin pa 'di ni 'du shes kyi phung po'o //
translated: The aggregate of perception is the grasping of signs such as blue, yellow, long, short, male, female, friend, enemy, pleasure, pain, etc.

original: bzhi las gzhan ni 'du byed phung //
analyzed: bzhi las gzhan ni 'du byed phung //
translated: The other than the four is the aggregate of formations.

original: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
analyzed: gzugs dang / tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'og nas 'byung ba'i rnam par shes pa'i phung po las gzhan pa'i 'du byed rnams ni 'du byed kyi phung po'o //
translated: The formations other than form, feeling, perception, and the consciousness aggregate to be explained below are the formations aggregate.

original: 'di dag las gsum tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste /üîΩskye mched dang khams rnam par gzhag par ni rig byed min /üîΩ'dus ma byas su bcas pa ni //
analyzed: 'di dag las gsum tshor ba dang / 'du shes dang / 'du byed kyi phung po dag ste / skye mched dang khams rnam par gzhag par ni rig byed min / 'dus ma byas su bcas pa ni //
translated: Three of these are the feeling, perception, and formations aggregates.üîΩThe unmanifest is not included in the aggregates.

original: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya //
analyzed: chos kyi skye mched khams zhes bya //
translated: The unconditioned is the phenomena element and phenomena base.

original: de ltar na rdzas bdun po 'di dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang khams su bstan to //
analyzed: de ltar na rdzas bdun po 'di dag ni chos kyi skye mched dang khams su bstan to //
translated: Thus these seven substances are taught to be the phenomena base and phenomena element.

original: rnam shes so so rnam rig pa //
analyzed: rnam shes so so rnam rig pa //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the individual perception of each object.

original: yul dang yul so so la dmigs shing rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
analyzed: yul dang yul so so la dmigs shing rnam par rig pa ni rnam par shes pa'i phung po zhes bya'o //
translated: The aggregate of consciousness is the perception of each object.

original: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
analyzed: de yang rnam par shes pa'i tshogs drug ste /
translated: It is the group of six consciousnesses.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The group of six consciousnesses is the eye consciousness up to the mind consciousness.üîΩThe aggregate of consciousness is explained in this way.

original: gang 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad pa dag skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni /
analyzed: gang 'di ltar rnam par shes pa'i phung po bshad pa dag skye mched rnam par gzhag pa ni /
translated: The sense bases are established on the basis of the aggregate of consciousness.

original: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin /üîΩkhams rnam par gzhag par yang de nyid de /
analyzed: yid kyi skye mched kyang de yin / khams rnam par gzhag par yang de nyid de /
translated: The mind sense base is also that.üîΩThe elements are also established on the basis of the aggregate of consciousness.

original: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa yin //
analyzed: khams bdun dag tu'ang 'dod pa yin //
translated: The seven elements are also asserted.

original: bdun po dag gang zhe na /
analyzed: bdun po dag gang zhe na /
translated: What are the seven?

original: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa drug dang yid //
translated: The six consciousnesses and the mind.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams dang yid kyi khams kyi bar du'o //
translated: The seven elements are the eye consciousness element up to the mind consciousness element and the mind element.

original: de ltar na 'dir phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dag dang / khams bco brgyad dag tu rnam par bstan par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de ltar na 'dir phung po lnga dang / skye mched bcu gnyis dag dang / khams bco brgyad dag tu rnam par bstan par 'gyur te /
translated: Thus, the five aggregates, twelve sense bases, and eighteen elements are indicated here.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dag dang / khams bcu dag go //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa ma gtogs pa gzugs kyi phung po ni skye mched bcu dag dang / khams bcu dag go //
translated: The form aggregate, excluding nonindicative form, is the ten sense bases and the ten elements.

original: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: tshor ba la sogs pa'i phung po dang / rnam par rig byed ma yin pa dang / 'dus ma byas dag ni skye mched dang / chos kyi khams so //
translated: The feeling aggregate and so on, nonindicative form and unconditioned states are the sense base and element of mental objects.

original: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang yid kyi khams so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i phung po ni yid kyi skye mched dang / rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang yid kyi khams so //
translated: The consciousness aggregate is the mental faculty sense base and the six consciousness elements and the mind element.

original: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i @99b tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad na 'dir de dag las gzhan pa'i yid kyi khams gang yin zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na rnam par shes pa'i @99b tshogs drug ni rnam par shes pa'i phung por bshad na 'dir de dag las gzhan pa'i yid kyi khams gang yin zhe na /
translated: If the six collections of consciousness are explained to be the consciousness aggregate, then what is the mind element that is different from them?

original: gzhan ni gang yang med mod kyi 'on kyang de dag nyid /
analyzed: gzhan ni gang yang med mod kyi 'on kyang de dag nyid /
translated: There is nothing else at all, but they are the mind element.

original: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
analyzed: drug po 'das ma thag pa yi //
translated: The six that have just ceased are the mind base and the mind element.

original: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
analyzed: rnam shes gang yin de yid do //
translated: The consciousnesses are the mind.üîΩThe consciousnesses are the mind element.

original: 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
analyzed: 'das ma thag pa'i rnam par shes pa gang dang gang yin pa de dang de ni yid kyi khams zhes bya ste /
translated: The consciousness that has just passed away becomes the mind basis of the present consciousness.

original: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na bu de nyid gzhan gyi phar 'gyur ba dang / 'bras bu de nyid gzhan gyi sa bon yin pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, a son is the father of another man, and a fruit is the seed of another tree.

original: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams rnams gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du ni khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur na /
analyzed: de lta na yang rnam par shes pa'i khams drug dang / yid kyi khams rnams gcig gi nang du gcig 'dus pa'i phyir rdzas nyid du ni khams bcu bdun nam bcu gnyis su 'gyur na /
translated: If the six consciousness elements and the mind element are included in the mind element, then there are seventeen or twelve real substances, not eighteen elements.

original: ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir khams bco brgyad du rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: Why are eighteen elements established?

original: de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang /üîΩdrug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
analyzed: de lta yin mod kyi 'on kyang / drug pa'i rten ni rab bsgrub phyir //
translated: Even though this is so,üîΩthe eighteen elements are accepted

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu 'dod //
translated: in order to establish the support of the sixth.

original: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi gnas dag ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa'i khams lnga po dag gi gnas dag ni mig gi khams la sogs pa yin na /
translated: The six consciousness elements have the eye element, etc., as their support.

original: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni gnas gzhan med de /
analyzed: drug pa yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni gnas gzhan med de /
translated: The sixth element, i.e., the mental faculty, has no other location.

original: de'i phyir de'i gnas rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
analyzed: de'i phyir de'i gnas rab tu bsgrub par bya ba'i phyir yid kyi khams bstan to //
translated: Therefore, the mental faculty is taught in order to establish its location.

original: de ltar na gnas dang / gnas pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad dag tu 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na gnas dang / gnas pa dang / dmigs pa rnam par gzhag pas khams bco brgyad dag tu 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the eighteen elements are established by the classification of location, the located, and the object.

original: de la phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so ;
analyzed: de la phung po dag gis ni 'dus byas thams cad bsdus so ;
translated: In this regard, all conditioned things are included in the aggregates.

original: / nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
analyzed: / nye bar len pa'i phung po dag gis ni zag pa dang bcas pa'i chos thams cad bsdus so //
translated: All things that are subject to impurity are included in the appropriating aggregates.

original: skye mched dang / khams kyis ni chos thams cad do //
analyzed: skye mched dang / khams kyis ni chos thams cad do //
translated: All things are included in the bases and elements.

original: mdor bsdus te shes par bya ba ni //
analyzed: mdor bsdus te shes par bya ba ni //
translated: In brief, one should know that

original: phung po dang ni skye mched dang // khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus /
analyzed: phung po dang ni skye mched dang // khams gcig gis ni thams cad bsdus /
translated: all are included in one aggregate, one base, and one element.

original: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzugs kyi phung po dang / yid kyi skye mched dang / chos kyi khams kyis chos thams cad bsdus par rig par bya'o //
translated: One should know that all things are included in the form aggregate, the mental faculty base, and the entity element.

original: yang 'di ltar bsdu ba de ni //
analyzed: yang 'di ltar bsdu ba de ni //
translated: This is the way in which they are included.

original: gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung //
analyzed: gang dang gang nas 'byung yang rung //
translated: Whatever the case,

original: gang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te //
analyzed: gang gi ngo bo nyid kyis te //
translated: it is included in that which is of its own nature.

original: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: gzhan gyi dngos pos ni ma yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood that it is not included in that which is of another nature.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /üîΩgzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na / gzhan gyi dngos dang mi ldan phyir //
translated: Why is this?üîΩBecause it is not associated with another nature.

original: chos gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pas /
analyzed: chos gzhan gyi dngos po dang mi ldan pas /
translated: Since it is not associated with the nature of another factor,

original: de bas na gang dang mi ldan pa de nyid kyis bsdus par ni mi rung ste /
analyzed: de bas na gang dang mi ldan pa de nyid kyis bsdus par ni mi rung ste /
translated: it is not appropriate that it be included in that which is not associated with it.

original: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / mig gi skye mched dang khams dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag gis bsdus te /
analyzed: dper na mig gi dbang po ni gzugs kyi phung po dang / mig gi skye mched dang khams dang / sdug bsngal ba dang / kun 'byung gi bden pa dag gis bsdus te /
translated: For example, the eye faculty is included in the form aggregate, the eye sense base and element, the truth of suffering, and the truth of origination,

original: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i bdag nyid yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it is of their nature.

original: @100a * // de'i ngo bo dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: @100a * // de'i ngo bo dang mi ldan pa'i phyir phung po la sogs pa gzhan dag gis ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not included in the other aggregates, etc., because it is not of their nature.

original: 'o na mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pas khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
analyzed: 'o na mig dang / rna ba dang / sna dag gnyis gnyis yod pas khams nyi shu rtsa gcig tu mi 'gyur ram zhe na /
translated: Well, if the eye, ear, and nose exist in pairs, wouldn‚Äôt there be twenty-one elements?

original: mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: mi 'gyur te /
translated: There would not be,

original: gang gi phyir /
analyzed: gang gi phyir /
translated: because

original: mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi //üîΩrigs dang spyod yul rnam par shes //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa gnyis mod kyi // rigs dang spyod yul rnam par shes //
translated: The eye and so on are two,üîΩbut the element is one, because of similarity of type,

original: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid //
analyzed: 'dra ba'i phyir na khams gcig nyid //
translated: of object, and of consciousness.

original: de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyi ga yang mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la rigs 'dra ba ni gnyi ga yang mig gi rang bzhin yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarity of type means that both are of the nature of eye.

original: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyi ga'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: spyod yul 'dra ba ni gnyi ga'i yul gzugs yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Similarity of object means that both have form as their object.

original: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa 'dra ba ni gnyi ga yang mig gi rnam par shes pa gcig gi gnas yin pa'i phyir te /
translated: Similarity of consciousness means that both are the basis of one eye consciousness.

original: de bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bas na mig gi khams ni gcig pa nyid do //
translated: Therefore, the eye element is one.

original: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rna ba dang / sna la yang sbyar bar bya'o //
translated: The same is true of the ear and nose.

original: mdzes pa'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ste //
analyzed: mdzes pa'i phyir na gnyis 'byung ste //
translated: Two arise for the sake of beauty.

original: mig la sogs pa khams gcig pa nyid yin yang gnas mdzes pa'i phyir gnyis 'byung ngo //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa khams gcig pa nyid yin yang gnas mdzes pa'i phyir gnyis 'byung ngo //
translated: Even though the eye and so on are one element, two arise for the sake of beauty of the body.

original: de lta ma yin na mig dang rna ba'i rten gcig pa dang / sna'i bu ga gcig tu gyur na shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de lta ma yin na mig dang rna ba'i rten gcig pa dang / sna'i bu ga gcig tu gyur na shin tu mi mdzes pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Otherwise, if the support of the eye and ear were one, or if the nostrils were one, the body would be very ugly.

original: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag bshad zin to //
analyzed: phung po dang / khams dang / skye mched dag bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregates, bases, and elements have been explained.

original: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams kyi don ci yin pa 'di brjod par bya ste /üîΩspungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don //üîΩphung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
analyzed: phung po dang / skye mched dang / khams kyi don ci yin pa 'di brjod par bya ste / spungs dang skye sgo rigs kyi don // phung po skye mched khams rnams yin //
translated: Now, what is the meaning of the aggregates, bases, and elements?

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po'i don to //
translated: The meaning of the aggregates is a heap;

original: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
analyzed: skye ba'i sgo'i don ni skye mched kyi don to //
translated: the meaning of the bases is a gateway;

original: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to //
analyzed: rigs kyi don ni khams kyi don to //
translated: the meaning of the elements is a species.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the aggregates? The meaning of the aggregates is a heap.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the bases? The meaning of the bases is a gateway.üîΩWhat is the meaning of the elements? The meaning of the elements is a species.

original: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad ce na /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir bcom ldan 'das kyis phung po la sogs pa'i sgo nas rnam pa gsum ston par mdzad ce na /
translated: Why did the BhagavƒÅn teach the three aspects of the aggregates, etc.?

original: gdul bya rnams kyi phyir te /üîΩrmongs dbang dang rnam gsum gyi phyir //
analyzed: gdul bya rnams kyi phyir te / rmongs dbang dang rnam gsum gyi phyir //
translated: He did so for the sake of disciples.

original: phung po la sogs gsum bstan to //üîΩgsum zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: phung po la sogs gsum bstan to // gsum zhes bya ba ni rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: The three aspects of the aggregates, etc., are taught for the sake of the three types of disciples.üîΩThe three types of disciples are those who are confused about the self, those who are confused about the elements, and those who are confused about both.

original: sems can rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
analyzed: sems can rmongs pa rnam pa gsum gyi phyir te /
translated: The three aspects are taught for the sake of the first type of disciple.

original: kha cig ni ril pos bdag tu 'dzin pas sems las 'byung ba rnams la rmongs so //
analyzed: kha cig ni ril pos bdag tu 'dzin pas sems las 'byung ba rnams la rmongs so //
translated: The aggregates are taught for the sake of those who are confused about the self.

original: kha cig ni gzugs nyid la'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs nyid la'o //
translated: Some are based on form alone.

original: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems gnyi ga la'o //
analyzed: kha cig ni gzugs dang sems gnyi ga la'o //
translated: Some are based on both form and mind.

original: dbang po dag kyang gsum ste /
analyzed: dbang po dag kyang gsum ste /
translated: The faculties are also of three types:

original: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dbang po rnon po dang / 'bring dang / rtul po'i phyir ro //
translated: sharp, medium, and dull.

original: dad pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
analyzed: dad pa la yang rnam pa gsum ste /
translated: Faith is also of three types:

original: gzhung bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po la dad pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: gzhung bsdus pa dang / bar ma dang / rgya chen po la dad pa'i phyir te /
translated: faith in the scriptures, faith in the teaching, and faith in the spiritual community.

original: de dag ni phung po dang / skye @100b mched dang / khams gsum bstan pa dang go rims bzhin no //üîΩyang ci'i phyir sems las byung ba gzhan ni 'du byed kyi phung por gcig tu byas la /
analyzed: de dag ni phung po dang / skye @100b mched dang / khams gsum bstan pa dang go rims bzhin no // yang ci'i phyir sems las byung ba gzhan ni 'du byed kyi phung por gcig tu byas la /
translated: These three types of faith correspond to the three types of person: those who are attracted to the scriptures, those who are attracted to the teaching, and those who are attracted to the spiritual community.

original: tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
analyzed: tshor ba dang 'du shes dag ni logs shig tu phung por byas she na /
translated: Why are the other mental factors combined into one aggregate of formations, while feeling and conception are each made into a separate aggregate?üîΩIt is said:

original: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag dang ni //
analyzed: smras pa / rtsod pa'i rtsa bdag dang ni //
translated: Because they are the roots of dispute,

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim gyi phyir //
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu phyir rim gyi phyir //
translated: because they are the causes of cyclic existence,üîΩbecause they are the principal factors,

original: sems 'byung dag las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por bstan //
analyzed: sems 'byung dag las tshor ba dang // 'du shes logs shig phung por bstan //
translated: feeling and conception are taught as separate aggregates from among the mental factors.

original: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dag ni gnyis te /
analyzed: rtsod pa'i rtsa ba dag ni gnyis te /
translated: The roots of dispute are two:

original: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa'o //
analyzed: 'dod pa la lhag par zhen pa'o //
translated: It is attachment to the object of desire.

original: de gnyis kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni rim pa bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis kyi gtso bo'i rgyu ni rim pa bzhin du tshor ba dang / 'du shes dag ste /
translated: The principal causes of these two are, respectively, feeling and ideation.

original: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis lta ba rnams su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: tshor ba ro myang ba'i dbang gis 'dod pa la mngon par zhen pa'i phyir dang / 'du shes phyin ci log gi dbang gis lta ba rnams su gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the power of the experience of feeling, one becomes attached to the object of desire. Because of the power of erroneous ideation, one becomes attached to the object of view.

original: 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang de dag yin te /
analyzed: 'khor ba'i rgyu'i gtso bo yang de dag yin te /
translated: These two are also the principal causes of cyclic existence.

original: tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pas ni 'khor ro //
analyzed: tshor ba la zhen pa dang / 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pas ni 'khor ro //
translated: One cycles in existence because of attachment to feeling and because of erroneous ideation.

original: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu'o //
analyzed: gang yang phung po'i go rims kyi rgyu'o //
translated: The order of the aggregates is also the order of the bases and elements.

original: gnas ston pa'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gnas ston pa'i go rims kyi rgyu de'i phyir yang 'di gnyis logs shig tu phung por byas par rig par bya ste /
translated: Therefore, these two should be understood as separate aggregates because they are the principal causes of the order of the aggregates.

original: de ni de nyid du bshad par bya'o //üîΩyang ci'i phyir skye mched dang / khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la /
analyzed: de ni de nyid du bshad par bya'o // yang ci'i phyir skye mched dang / khams dag tu ni 'dus ma byas bshad la /
translated: This will be explained in the section on the order of the aggregates.

original: phung po dag tu ni 'dus ma byas ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: phung po dag tu ni 'dus ma byas ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why are unconditioned things explained as being part of the bases and elements but not part of the aggregates?

original: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
analyzed: phung po dag tu 'dus ma byas //
translated: The unconditioned is not included among the aggregates.

original: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad //
analyzed: don du mi rung phyir ma bshad //
translated: It is not mentioned as an aggregate because it is not appropriate as an object.

original: de phung po dag gi nang du brjod na /
analyzed: de phung po dag gi nang du brjod na /
translated: If it is asked why the unconditioned is not mentioned as an aggregate,

original: re zhig de gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: re zhig de gzugs ma yin zhing rnam par shes pa'i bar du yang ma yin pas don du mi rung pa'i phyir te /
translated: it is because it is not appropriate as an object, since it is not form and so on up to it is not consciousness.

original: de nyid du bsdu ba ni mi nus so //
analyzed: de nyid du bsdu ba ni mi nus so //
translated: It cannot be included in those.

original: don du mi rung ba'i phyir phung po drug pa brjod par yang ga la nus te /
analyzed: don du mi rung ba'i phyir phung po drug pa brjod par yang ga la nus te /
translated: How could it be possible to mention it as a sixth aggregate, since it is not appropriate as an object?

original: spungs pa'i don ni phung po zhes bshad na /
analyzed: spungs pa'i don ni phung po zhes bshad na /
translated: If the meaning of aggregate is explained as a heap,

original: 'dus ma byas ni spungs pa'i don du mi 'thad do //
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni spungs pa'i don du mi 'thad do //
translated: then it is not tenable that the unconditioned is a heap.

original: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya la /
analyzed: yang kun nas nyon mongs pa'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir nye bar len pa'i phung po zhes bya la /
translated: Moreover, the appropriating aggregates are mentioned in order to understand the things that are thoroughly afflicted.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir phung po zhes kyang bya na /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa dang / rnam par byang ba'i dngos po shes par bya ba'i phyir phung po zhes kyang bya na /
translated: The aggregates are mentioned in order to understand the things that are thoroughly afflicted and the things that are thoroughly pure.

original: 'dus ma byas ni don du mi rung pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin te /
analyzed: 'dus ma byas ni don du mi rung pa'i phyir gnyi ga yang ma yin te /
translated: But the unconditioned is not both of those because it is not appropriate as an object.

original: de'i phyir de dag tu rnam par ma bzhag go //
analyzed: de'i phyir de dag tu rnam par ma bzhag go //
translated: Therefore, they are not included in the aggregates.

original: phung po'i rnam par gzhag pa dag ni bshad zin to //
analyzed: phung po'i rnam par gzhag pa dag ni bshad zin to //
translated: The aggregates have already been explained.

original: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
analyzed: rim ni rags dang kun nyon mongs //
translated: The order of the elements is established according to grossness, defilement,

original: snod sogs khams kyi don las so //
analyzed: snod sogs khams kyi don las so //
translated: receptivity, and so on.

original: gzugs ni thams cad pas rags pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gzugs ni thams cad pas rags pa dang thogs pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Form is the grossest of all, because it is subject to impingement.

original: gzugs can ma @101a * //
analyzed: gzugs can ma @101a * //
translated: Among the incorporeal elements,

original: yin pa rnams la yang tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa ste /
analyzed: yin pa rnams la yang tshor ba ni rgyu ba rags pa ste /
translated: feeling is the grossest, because it is the most obvious.

original: 'di ltar nga'i klad pa la tshor ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar nga'i klad pa la tshor ro //
translated: Thus, people say, ‚ÄúI have a headache,‚Äù

original: nga'i klad pa phyed la tshor ro //üîΩzhes brjod do //
analyzed: nga'i klad pa phyed la tshor ro // zhes brjod do //
translated: ‚ÄúI have a pain in my side.‚Äù

original: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
analyzed: 'du shes ni gnyis pas ches rags so //
translated: Perception is grosser than consciousness.

original: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa bas ni 'du byed de /
translated: Formations are grosser than consciousness.

original: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
analyzed: de'i phyir gang ches rags pa de sngar bshad do //
translated: Therefore, the grossest is taught first.

original: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na skyes pa dang / bud med dag gzugs la phan tshun mngon par dga' ste /
analyzed: yang na thog ma med pa can gyi 'khor ba na skyes pa dang / bud med dag gzugs la phan tshun mngon par dga' ste /
translated: Or else, in beginningless samsara, men and women are attracted to each other because of their forms.

original: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de dag kyang tshor ba'i ro myang ba la chags pa'i phyir ro //
translated: And they are attached to the taste of feeling.

original: chags pa de yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chags pa de yang 'du shes phyin ci log tu gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Moreover, this attachment is due to a perversion of ideation.

original: phyin ci log de yang nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
analyzed: phyin ci log de yang nyon mongs pa dag gis so //
translated: And this perversion is due to the defilements.

original: sems de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pas ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i go rims bzhin no //
analyzed: sems de ni kun nas nyon mongs pa can yin pas ji ltar nyon mongs pa'i go rims bzhin no //
translated: And this thought is defiled, thus, in the order of the defilements.

original: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
analyzed: yang na snod la sogs pa'i don gyis te /
translated: Or else, in the sense of receptacle, etc.

original: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang / zas dang / tshod ma dang / byed pa po dang / zab po lta bur gyur pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa'i phung po ni snod dang / zas dang / tshod ma dang / byed pa po dang / zab po lta bur gyur pa'o //
translated: The aggregates of form, etc., are like a receptacle, food, seasoning, the agent, the experiencer.

original: yang na khams las te /
analyzed: yang na khams las te /
translated: Or else, in the sense of element.

original: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i yon tan gzugs kyis rab tu phye ba ni 'dod pa'i khams so //
translated: The realm of desire is distinguished by the object of desire which is form.

original: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
analyzed: tshor bas rab tu phye ba ni bsam gtan rnams so //
translated: The meditations are distinguished by sensation.

original: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
analyzed: 'du shes kyis rab tu phye ba ni gzugs med pa gsum mo //
translated: The three formless perceptional spheres are distinguished by ideation.

original: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
analyzed: 'du byed tsam gyis rab tu phye ba ni srid pa'i rtse mo'o //
translated: The summit of cyclic existence is distinguished by the mere conditioning forces.

original: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas pas 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag ste /
analyzed: de dag la rnam par shes pa gnas pas 'di dag ni rnam par shes pa gnas pa dag ste /
translated: Since consciousness is located in them, they are the stations of consciousness.

original: phung po'i go rims ni zhing dang sa bon lta bu'i go rims su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phung po'i go rims ni zhing dang sa bon lta bu'i go rims su bstan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The order of the aggregates is taught in the order of fields and seeds.

original: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni lnga kho na ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
analyzed: de'i phyir phung po rnams ni lnga kho na ste mi nyung mi mang ngo //
translated: Therefore, the aggregates are only five in number, neither more nor less.üîΩThus, they are the most coarse, the order of the causes of affliction, like food and drink, and they are the two realms.

original: de bas na de dag ni ches rags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i rim pa dang / zas dang tshod ma lta bur gyur pa dang / des khams gnyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir go rims kyi rgyu tshor ba dang / 'du shes ni /üîΩ'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
analyzed: de bas na de dag ni ches rags pa dang / nyon mongs pa'i rgyu'i rim pa dang / zas dang tshod ma lta bur gyur pa dang / des khams gnyis rab tu phye ba'i phyir go rims kyi rgyu tshor ba dang / 'du shes ni / 'du byed rnams las logs shig tu phung por byas so //
translated: Thus, feeling and conception are made into separate aggregates from the formations.

original: mig la sogs pa khams dang skye mched drug gi go rims dag brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: mig la sogs pa khams dang skye mched drug gi go rims dag brjod par bya ste /
translated: The order of the six elements and bases that are the eyes, etc., should be explained.

original: de bstan pa nyid kyis de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i go rims kyang yin no //
analyzed: de bstan pa nyid kyis de'i yul dang rnam par shes pa'i go rims kyang yin no //
translated: By teaching that, the order of their objects and consciousnesses is also taught.

original: drug po de dag kyang /üîΩda lta'i don phyir dang po lnga //
analyzed: drug po de dag kyang / da lta'i don phyir dang po lnga //
translated: Those six areüîΩthe first five, because their objects are present.

original: mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da lta'i yin pa'i phyir dang por bshad do //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa lnga'i yul ni da lta'i yin pa'i phyir dang por bshad do //
translated: The objects of the first five, the eyes, etc., are present.

original: yid ni ma nges te /
analyzed: yid ni ma nges te /
translated: The mental faculty is not determined.

original: kha cig gi yul ni da ltar ro //
analyzed: kha cig gi yul ni da ltar ro //
translated: The object of some is present.

original: kha cig gi yul ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: kha cig gi yul ni dus gsum dang dus ma yin pa'o //
translated: The object of some is the three times and the non-time.

original: 'byung ba las gyur @101b don phyir bzhi //üîΩdang por zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur @101b don phyir bzhi // dang por zhes bya bar sbyar ro //
translated: Four are derived from the elements, because their object is derived from the elements.

original: lnga rnams las kyang bzhi lngar bshad pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lnga rnams las kyang bzhi lngar bshad pa ni yul 'byung ba las gyur pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The first, i.e., the five sense faculties, are derived from the four great elements.

original: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te //üîΩres 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag go //üîΩres 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
analyzed: lus kyi yul ni ma nges te // res 'ga' ni 'byung ba dag go // res 'ga' ni 'byung ba las gyur pa'o //
translated: The object of the body is not determined.

original: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga'o //
analyzed: res 'ga' ni gnyi ga'o //
translated: Sometimes it is the four great elements, sometimes it is derived from the four great elements, sometimes it is both.

original: gzhan ni ring dang rab myur 'jug / yang lhag ma gzhan ni ci rigs par ring ba dang / rab tu myur bar 'jug pas sngar smos te /
analyzed: gzhan ni ring dang rab myur 'jug / yang lhag ma gzhan ni ci rigs par ring ba dang / rab tu myur bar 'jug pas sngar smos te /
translated: The other faculties are mentioned first because they engage their objects either quickly or slowly.

original: mig dang / rna ba ni yul ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas sngar smos so //
analyzed: mig dang / rna ba ni yul ring ba'i phyir gnyis pas sngar smos so //
translated: The eye and ear are mentioned first because their objects are distant.

original: de gnyis las kyang /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang /
translated: Among those two,

original: mig ni shin tu ring ba la 'jug ste /
analyzed: mig ni shin tu ring ba la 'jug ste /
translated: the eye engages its object at a greater distance,

original: rlung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas /
analyzed: rlung rgyang ring po nas mthong yang de'i sgra mi thos pas /
translated: for one can see a flame burning in the sky at a great distance, but cannot hear its sound.

original: de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
analyzed: de'i phyir de sngar smos so //
translated: Therefore, it is mentioned first.

original: sna dang lce ni ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi /
analyzed: sna dang lce ni ring po la 'jug pa med mod kyi /
translated: The nose and tongue do not reach out to their objects.

original: de gnyis las kyang sna rab tu myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
analyzed: de gnyis las kyang sna rab tu myur bar 'jug pa'i phyir sngar smos te /
translated: But the nose is mentioned first because it operates more quickly than the tongue,

original: lce zas dang ma phrad pa nyid du dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: lce zas dang ma phrad pa nyid du dri 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: for the tongue does not perceive an odor that has not already reached it.

original: yang na ji ltar gnas bzhin rim //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar gnas bzhin rim //
translated: Or else, in the order in which they are grasped.

original: yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so //
analyzed: yang na lus 'di la mig gi rten ni dang po na gnas so //
translated: Or else, the support of the eye is the first,

original: de'i 'og na ni rna ba'i 'o //üîΩde'i 'og na ni sna'i'i //
analyzed: de'i 'og na ni rna ba'i 'o // de'i 'og na ni sna'i'i //
translated: then the support of the ear,üîΩthen the support of the nose,

original: de'i 'og na ni lce'i'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og na ni lce'i'o //
translated: then the support of the tongue,

original: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o //üîΩyid ni de dag la brten pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te //
analyzed: lus kyi ni phal cher de'i 'og na'o // yid ni de dag la brten pa dang / yul na mi gnas pa'i phyir te //
translated: then the support of the body,

original: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no //
analyzed: de dag gi go rims ni ji ltar gnas pa bzhin yin no //
translated: and the mental faculty is the last, because it is supported on them and because it does not have a specific location.üîΩThe order of the sense faculties is determined by their position in the body.

original: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi skye mched bcu po de dag las gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched du bstan la /
analyzed: yang ci'i phyir gzugs kyi bdag nyid kyi skye mched bcu po de dag las gcig ni gzugs kyi skye mched du bstan la /
translated: Why are the ten sense-spheres of the nature of form called sense-spheres of form?

original: thams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
analyzed: thams cad kyang chos kyi rang bzhin yin na gcig chos kyi skye mched ces bya zhe na /
translated: If all are the nature of mental objects, why is one called the mental object sense sphere?

original: smras pa / khyad par don dang gtso bo'i phyir //
analyzed: smras pa / khyad par don dang gtso bo'i phyir //

original: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'jam pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te /üîΩ'byung bdag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: 'byung ba las gyur pa ni 'jam pa la sogs pa rnam pa bdun te / 'byung bdag la yod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The seven types of tangibles that are derived from the primary elements are smoothness,üîΩroughness, heaviness, lightness, cold, hunger, and thirst.

original: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
analyzed: lhag ma gzugs can dgu po ni //
translated: The remaining nine elements are not derived from the primary elements.

original: 'byung gyur dbang po lnga'i khams dang / yul bzhi po de dag ni 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
analyzed: 'byung gyur dbang po lnga'i khams dang / yul bzhi po de dag ni 'byung ba las gyur pa nyid do //
translated: The five sense faculties of form, the four objects of form, smell, taste, and tangible objects are derived from the primary elements.

original: chos khams phyogs gcig kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
analyzed: chos khams phyogs gcig kyang 'byung ba las gyur pa ste /
translated: One part of the element of mental objects is also derived from the primary elements.

original: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: rnam par rig byed ma yin pa zhes bya'o //
translated: This is called non-revealing form.

original: de'i phyir gzhan dag ni gnyi ga ma yin par grub po //üîΩbstsags pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: de'i phyir gzhan dag ni gnyi ga ma yin par grub po // bstsags pa rnams ni du /
translated: The other elements are not derived from the primary elements.üîΩHow many elements are aggregated?

original: bstsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
analyzed: bstsags pa ma yin pa rnams ni du zhe na /
translated: How many are not aggregated?

original: gzugs can bcu ni bstsags pa'o //
analyzed: gzugs can bcu ni bstsags pa'o //
translated: The ten elements of form are aggregated.

original: dbang po lnga'i khams dag yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bstsags pa'o //
analyzed: dbang po lnga'i khams dag yul lnga dag ni rdul phra rab 'dus pa yin pa'i phyir bstsags pa'o //
translated: The five sense faculties and the five object referents are agglomerations because they are aggregations of atoms.

original: khams bco brgyad rnams las gcod par byed pa ni gang /üîΩgcad par bya ba ni gang zhig / sreg par byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: khams bco brgyad rnams las gcod par byed pa ni gang / gcad par bya ba ni gang zhig / sreg par byed pa ni gang /
translated: Among the eighteen elements, which are the cutting, the cut, etc.?

original: bsreg par bya ba ni gang zhig /'jal bar byed pa ni gang /
analyzed: bsreg par bya ba ni gang zhig /'jal bar byed pa ni gang /
translated: Which are the burning, the weighed, etc.?

original: gzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhig ce na /üîΩgcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: gzhal bar bya ba ni gang zhig ce na / gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: Which are the cutting, the cut?

original: phyi rol khams ni bzhi yin no //
analyzed: phyi rol khams ni bzhi yin no //
translated: The four external elements are the cutting and the cut.

original: gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba ni dgra sta dang / shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o //üîΩji ltar / gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang / reg bya zhes bya ba ni dgra sta dang / shing la sogs pa zhes bya ba'o // ji ltar / gcod byed gcad par bya ba nyid //
translated: The four external elements, i.e., the element of visible form, the element of odor, the element of taste, the element of tangibility, are the cutting, the axe, etc.

original: phyi rol khams bzhi yin pa ltar //
analyzed: phyi rol khams bzhi yin pa ltar //
translated: Just as the four external elements are the cutting and the cut,

original: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal ba'o //üîΩde nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
analyzed: de bzhin bsreg bya 'jal ba'o // de nyid bsreg par bya ba yin la /
translated: so too are they the burning and the weighed.üîΩThe four external elements are the burning, the weighed.

original: de nyid 'jal bar byed pa yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid 'jal bar byed pa yang yin no //
translated: The four external elements are the weighing scale.

original: sreg dang 'jal la mi mthun smra /
analyzed: sreg dang 'jal la mi mthun smra /
translated: There is disagreement about the burning and the weighed.

original: kha cig ni khams bzhi @105b po de nyid sreg par byed pa dang / gzhal bar bya ba yang yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: kha cig ni khams bzhi @105b po de nyid sreg par byed pa dang / gzhal bar bya ba yang yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Some say: The four primary elements are both that which burns and that which is weighed.

original: kha cig ni me'i khams nyid sreg par byed pa yin la /
analyzed: kha cig ni me'i khams nyid sreg par byed pa yin la /
translated: Some say: The fire element is that which burns.

original: lci ba nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod do //
analyzed: lci ba nyid gzhal bar bya ba yin no zhes brjod do //
translated: Weight is that which is weighed.

original: khams rnams las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: khams rnams las rnam par smin pa las skyes pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many elements are derived from the cause of karmic maturation?

original: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are derived from the cause of enhancement?

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba rnams ni du /
translated: How many are derived from the cause of natural outflow?

original: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: rdzas dang ldan pa rnams ni du /
translated: How many possess substance?üîΩHow many are momentary?

original: skad cig pa rnams ni du zhig ce na /
analyzed: skad cig pa rnams ni du zhig ce na /
translated: It is said:

original: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas pa las byung nang gi lnga //
analyzed: smras pa / rnam par smin las skyes pa dang // rgyas pa las byung nang gi lnga //
translated: The five internal elements are derived from the cause of karmic maturation and the cause of enhancement.

original: re zhig mig la sogs pa nang gi khams lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la /üîΩrgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: re zhig mig la sogs pa nang gi khams lnga po dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin la /üîΩrgyas pa las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: The five internal elements of the eye and so on are derived from the cause of karmic maturation and the cause of enhancement.

original: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni yod kyi /
analyzed: sgra ni rgyas pa las byung ba dang / rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ni yod kyi /
translated: Sound is of two types:

original: rnam smin las skyes sgra ma yin //
analyzed: rnam smin las skyes sgra ma yin //
translated: Sound is not arisen from ripening.

original: ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: 'dod dgur 'jug pa'i phyir ro //üîΩrgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
analyzed: 'dod dgur 'jug pa'i phyir ro // rgyu mthun las byung rnam smin skyes //
translated: Because it is produced at will.

original: thogs pa med brgyad /
analyzed: thogs pa med brgyad /
translated: The eight elements that are not capable of being sensed are of two types.

original: brgyad gang zhe na /
analyzed: brgyad gang zhe na /
translated: Which eight?

original: sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams te /üîΩskal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
analyzed: sems kyi khams bdun dang / chos kyi khams te / skal ba mnyam pa dang / kun du 'gro ba'i rgyus bskyed pa ni rgyu mthun pa las byung ba'o //
translated: The seven elements of consciousness and the element of mental objects.üîΩThe eight elements that are not capable of being sensed are of two types:

original: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par smin pa'i rgyus bskyed pa ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa'o //
translated: arisen from the cause of similar type and arisen from the cause of retribution.

original: brgyad pa las byung ba ni med do //
analyzed: brgyad pa las byung ba ni med do //
translated: The eight elements that are not capable of being sensed are not arisen from accumulation.üîΩWhy is that?

original: thogs pa med pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro //üîΩgzhan rnam gsum /
analyzed: thogs pa med pa la sogs pa med pa'i phyir ro // gzhan rnam gsum /
translated: Because there is no accumulation in the formless realm.üîΩThe other three.

original: gzhan ni lhag ma bzhi ste /
analyzed: gzhan ni lhag ma bzhi ste /
translated: The other three elements are of three types.

original: gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams so //
analyzed: gzugs dang / dri dang ro dang reg bya'i khams rnams so //
translated: The elements of form, smell, and taste are of three types:

original: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin /
analyzed: de dag ni rnam par smin pa las skyes pa yang yin /
translated: arisen from the cause of retribution,üîΩarisen from the cause of similar type, andüîΩarisen from the cause of accumulation.

original: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin //
analyzed: rgyas pa las byung ba yang yin //
translated: It is also derived from the cause of increase.

original: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yin no //
analyzed: rgyu mthun pa las byung ba yang yin no //
translated: It is also derived from the cause of natural outcome.

original: rdzas dang lhan cig /'dus ma byas ni bstan pa'i phyir rdzas so ;
analyzed: rdzas dang lhan cig /'dus ma byas ni bstan pa'i phyir rdzas so ;
translated: The term ‚Äúsubstantial‚Äù is used in order to indicate the unconditioned factors, which are not included in the other nine substances.

original: / de yang chos kyi khams dag la yod pas de'i phyir chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ni rdzas dang ldan pa'o //üîΩtha ma gsum /
analyzed: / de yang chos kyi khams dag la yod pas de'i phyir chos kyi khams kyi phyogs gcig ni rdzas dang ldan pa'o // tha ma gsum /
translated: Since they exist in the element of mental objects, the element of mental objects is said to be the only one that is substantial.

original: skad cig pa ste /
analyzed: skad cig pa ste /
translated: The last three are momentary.üîΩThe element of mental objects, the element of the mental faculty, and the element of mental consciousness are momentary.

original: yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni zag pa med pa'i dang po chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
analyzed: yid kyi khams dang chos kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams ni zag pa med pa'i dang po chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i tshogs la skad cig ma gcig rgyu mthun pa las byung ba ma yin par 'gyur te /
translated: The first moment of the uncontaminated state, which is the group of receptivities to the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering, is not derived from the cause of natural outcome.

original: de'i phyir skad cig ba zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir skad cig ba zhes bya'o //
translated: Therefore, it is called ‚Äúmomentary.‚Äù

original: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
analyzed: de la sdug bsngal la chos shes pa'i bzod pa'i sems mtshungs par ldan pa ni yid kyi khams dang / yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i khams so //
translated: In this context, the mind that is associated with the receptivity to the knowledge of the factors with regard to suffering is the element of the mental faculty and the element of mental consciousness.

original: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni chos kyi khams so //
analyzed: de dang lhan cig 'byung ba ni chos kyi khams so //
translated: The factors that occur simultaneously with it are the element of mental objects.

original: @106a * // 'di dpyad par bya ste /
analyzed: @106a * // 'di dpyad par bya ste /
translated: This should be analyzed.

original: gang mig gi khams kyis mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa na /
analyzed: gang mig gi khams kyis mi ldan pa ldan pa 'thob pa na /
translated: When one who does not possess the eye element obtains possession of it,üîΩdoes one also obtain possession of the eye consciousness element?

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis kyang de 'am mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi gang yin pa mig gi khams kyang de 'am zhe na smras pa /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis kyang de 'am mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyi gang yin pa mig gi khams kyang de 'am zhe na smras pa /
translated: Or does one who possesses the eye consciousness element also possess the eye element?üîΩIt is said:

original: mig dang ni /
analyzed: mig dang ni /
translated: There is possession of the eye andüîΩthe eye consciousness element individually.

original: rnam par shes khams so so dang // lhan cig tu ni 'thob pa'ang yod //üîΩre zhig so so ba yang yod de /
analyzed: rnam par shes khams so so dang // lhan cig tu ni 'thob pa'ang yod // re zhig so so ba yang yod de /
translated: There is possession of the eye and eye consciousness elements individually.

original: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang / gzugs med pa nas shi 'pho nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na mig gi khams kyis yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis ni ma yin no //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i khams na rim gyis mig gi dbang po 'thob pa dang / gzugs med pa nas shi 'pho nas bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skye ba na mig gi khams kyis yin la mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis ni ma yin no //
translated: One who gradually obtains the eye faculty in the desire realm and one who dies in the formless realm and is born in the second absorption and so on possess the eye element but not the eye consciousness element.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis ni yin la /üîΩmig gi khams kyis ma yin pa yang yod de /
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa'i khams kyis ni yin la / mig gi khams kyis ma yin pa yang yod de /
translated: One who possesses the eye consciousness elementüîΩbut not the eye element is one born in the second absorption and so on.

original: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa dag ste /
analyzed: bsam gtan gnyis pa la sogs par skyes pa dag ste /
translated: One who possesses the eye element but not the eye consciousness element is one born in the second absorption and so on.

original: mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon sum du byed pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o //
analyzed: mig gi rnam par shes pa mngon sum du byed pa dang / de nas shi 'phos nas 'og mar skye ba na'o //
translated: The first case is when the visual consciousness is actualized and then, after death, one is born in a lower stage.

original: cig car gnyi gas ldan par 'thob pa yang yod de /
analyzed: cig car gnyi gas ldan par 'thob pa yang yod de /
translated: The second case is when one possesses both at the same time.

original: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
analyzed: gzugs med pa nas shi 'phos nas 'dod pa'i khams dang / tshangs pa'i 'jig rten du skye ba na'o //
translated: The third case is when one dies in the formless realm and is born in the desire realm or the world of Brahma.

original: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o //üîΩkhams rnams las nang gi rnams ni du /
analyzed: gnyi ga ma yin pa ni rnam pa 'di dag ma gtogs pa'o // khams rnams las nang gi rnams ni du /
translated: The fourth case is when one does not possess either.

original: phyi rol gyi rnams ni du zhig ce na /
analyzed: phyi rol gyi rnams ni du zhig ce na /
translated: How many internal and how many external elements are there?

original: nang gi bcu gnyis /
analyzed: nang gi bcu gnyis /
translated: Twelve are internal.

original: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
analyzed: bcu gnyis gang zhe na /
translated: Which twelve?

original: gzugs la sogs /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs /
translated: The six sense faculties of eye, etc.,

original: ma gtogs / rnam par shes pa drug dang gnas drug ste khams bcu gnyis po de dag ni nang gi'o //
analyzed: ma gtogs / rnam par shes pa drug dang gnas drug ste khams bcu gnyis po de dag ni nang gi'o //
translated: and the six collections of consciousness.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug ni phyi rol gyi'o //üîΩkhams rnams la brten pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yul gyi khams drug ni phyi rol gyi'o // khams rnams la brten pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du /
translated: The six sense objects of form, etc., are external.üîΩHow many elements are with support?

original: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig ce na /
analyzed: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa rnams ni du zhig ce na /
translated: How many are without support?

original: re zhig nges par /
analyzed: re zhig nges par /
translated: First, definitely:

original: chos zhes bya ba ni /
analyzed: chos zhes bya ba ni /
translated: The term ‚Äúdharma‚Äù refers to

original: brten pa dang bcas /
analyzed: brten pa dang bcas /
translated: that which is supported.

original: rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du gang nges la /
analyzed: rnam par shes pa gang gi yul du gang nges la /
translated: That which is ascertained as the object of any consciousnessüîΩis said to be that which is supported.

original: gal te der rnam par shes pa de skyes pa'am skye ba'i chos kyi yul de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya la /
analyzed: gal te der rnam par shes pa de skyes pa'am skye ba'i chos kyi yul de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya la /
translated: That object of any consciousness that has arisen or will arise is said to be that which is supported.

original: chos kyi khams gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gang yang med de /
analyzed: chos kyi khams gang la yid kyi rnam par shes pa mtha' yas pa skyes pa'am skye bar mi 'gyur ba de ni gang yang med de /
translated: There is nothing whatsoever that is not the object of the infinite consciousnesses that arise or will arise in the element of mental objects.

original: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad la ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sems 'di nges par skye ste da yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs par chos thams cad dmigs pa yin la /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'phags pa'i gang zag thams cad la ni chos thams cad bdag med pa'i sems 'di nges par skye ste da yang rang gi ngo bo dang lhan cig 'byung ba ma gtogs par chos thams cad dmigs pa yin la /
translated: Thus, this thought that all dharmas are without a self definitely arises in all ƒÅryas. Moreover, all dharmas are the objects of this thought, except for its own nature and its simultaneous factors.

original: skad @106b cig pa gnyis pa'i dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur bas de bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag par brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: skad @106b cig pa gnyis pa'i dmigs par ni chos thams cad 'gyur bas de bas na chos kyi khams ni rtag par brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: Since all dharmas become the objects of the second moment of this thought, the element of mental objects is always that which is supported.

original: lhag ma ni de'i rten dang bcas pa yang /
analyzed: lhag ma ni de'i rten dang bcas pa yang /
translated: The remainder are that which is supported and that which supports.

original: yang gi sgras ni brten pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
analyzed: yang gi sgras ni brten pa dang bcas pa yang yin no //
translated: The word ‚Äúalso‚Äù indicates that the eye is also supported.üîΩWhat is its support?

original: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa 'di ci zhig / gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
analyzed: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa 'di ci zhig / gang zhig rang gi las mi byed //
translated: That which does not perform its own function.

original: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas par bstan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang rang gi las byed pa de ni brten pa dang bcas par bstan par 'gyur ro //
translated: That which performs its own function is said to be supported.

original: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
analyzed: de la mig gang gis gzugs rnams mthong ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba de ni brten pa dang bcas pa zhes bya ste /
translated: The eye is said to be supported when it sees visible form or is capable of seeing visible form.

original: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du yid kyi bar du yang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o//
analyzed: mig la ji lta ba bzhin du yid kyi bar du yang rang gi yul la byed pas brjod par bya'o//
translated: The same should be said of the mental faculty up to the mental faculty, according to its object.

original: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa'am /
analyzed: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa ni mig gang gis gzugs rnams ma mthong bar 'gags pa'am /
translated: The eye is not supported when it is obstructed from seeing visible form,

original: 'gog pa'am / 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
analyzed: 'gog pa'am / 'gag par 'gyur ba'am /
translated: or when it is destroyed, or is in the process of being destroyed,

original: gang yang mi skye ba'i chos can te /
analyzed: gang yang mi skye ba'i chos can te /
translated: or when it is not destined to arise.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same should be said of the body up to the body.

original: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos can nyid de de'i brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yid ni mi skye ba'i chos can nyid de de'i brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The mental faculty is not destined to arise.

original: yang gzugs rnams ni mig gis mthong ba'am lta ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
analyzed: yang gzugs rnams ni mig gis mthong ba'am lta ba'am lta bar 'gyur ba de dag ni brten pa dang bcas pa'o //
translated: The visible forms that are seen by the eye, that are looked at by the eye, that are to be looked at by the eye, are with support.

original: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
analyzed: de'i brten pa dang bcas pa ni rnam pa bzhi ste /
translated: The with-support of that is fourfold:

original: gang rnams ma mthong ba nyid du 'gags pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag mi skye ba'i chos rnams te /
analyzed: gang rnams ma mthong ba nyid du 'gags pa dang / 'gog pa dang / 'gag par 'gyur ba dang / gang dag mi skye ba'i chos rnams te /
translated: that which has ceased without being seen, that which is ceasing, that which will cease, and that which is not born.

original: de bzhin du reg bya'i bar du yang rang gi dbang pos byed pas brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de'i brten pa dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du reg bya'i bar du yang rang gi dbang pos byed pas brten pa dang bcas pa dang / de'i brten pa dang bcas par rig par bya'o //
translated: In the same way, the tangible is with-support by means of its own sense-faculty, and the with-support of that should be understood.

analyzed: de dag gi 'das pa'i gnas ni yid yin no // yang ci'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa ni gnyi ga la rag lus te /
translated: The mental faculty is the support of the past and future consciousnesses.

original: skye na mig la sogs pa nyid la gnas zhes bya'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: skye na mig la sogs pa nyid la gnas zhes bya'i gzugs la sogs pa la ni ma yin zhe na /
translated: Why is it that the visual consciousness, which arises in dependence on both, is said to be supported by the eye and not by form?

original: de gyur pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir //
analyzed: de gyur pa las 'gyur ba'i phyir //
translated: Because the consciousness changes when the sense organ changes,

original: gnas ni mig la sogs pa yin //üîΩkhams dag gi dbang du byas pa ste /üîΩmig la sogs pa rnams gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur te /
analyzed: gnas ni mig la sogs pa yin // khams dag gi dbang du byas pa ste / mig la sogs pa rnams gyur pas rnam par shes pa rnams 'gyur te /
translated: the sense organ is the support of the consciousness.üîΩThe sense organ is considered as the support of the consciousness in the sense that the consciousness changes when the sense organ changes.

original: phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: phan pa dang / gnod pa dang / gsal ba dang / mi gsal ba'i rjes su 'brel ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The consciousness changes when the sense organ changes, because the consciousness is related to the benefit or harm of the sense organ, and to the clarity or obscurity of the sense organ.

original: gzugs la sogs pa gyur pas ni de 'gyur ba ma yin te /
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa gyur pas ni de 'gyur ba ma yin te /
translated: The consciousness does not change when form changes.

original: de bas na de la rag lus pa'i phyir de nyid gnas yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni legs pa yin no //
analyzed: de bas na de la rag lus pa'i phyir de nyid gnas yin gyi gzugs la sogs pa ma yin no zhes bya ba ni legs pa yin no //
translated: Therefore, it is correct to say that the eye is the basis of visual consciousness, not form, because the latter is dependent on the former.

original: yang de dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes na /
analyzed: yang de dag gis ni gzugs la sogs pa rnam par shes na /
translated: If visual consciousness, etc. are consciousnesses of form, etc.,

analyzed: ci'i phyir mig gi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas yid kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar yin gyi /

original: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: gzugs kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba nas chos kyi rnam par shes pa zhes bya ba'i bar du ma yin zhe na /
translated: and not consciousness of form, etc.?

original: gang gi phyir de dag gi gnas ni mig la sogs pa de dag yin pa /
analyzed: gang gi phyir de dag gi gnas ni mig la sogs pa de dag yin pa /
translated: Because the eye, etc. are their basis,üîΩthey are called visual consciousness, etc.üîΩThey are called visual consciousness, etc.

original: de'i phyir thun mong ma @108b yin phyir //üîΩrnam shes de'i zhes nges par bshad //
analyzed: de'i phyir thun mong ma @108b yin phyir // rnam shes de'i zhes nges par bshad //
translated: because they are not shared in common.

original: ji ltar na thun mong ma yin zhe na /üîΩmig las gzhan pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas su 'gyur bar mi nus la /
analyzed: ji ltar na thun mong ma yin zhe na / mig las gzhan pa ni mig gi rnam par shes pa'i gnas su 'gyur bar mi nus la /

original: gzugs ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzugs ni yid kyi rnam par shes pa'i dmigs par yang 'gyur te /
translated: The eye is not capable of being the basis of visual consciousness, but form is the object of mental consciousness.

original: de bzhin du lus kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du lus kyi bar du yang rig par bya'o //
translated: The same applies up to the body.

original: de bas na gnas su gyur pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
analyzed: de bas na gnas su gyur pa dang thun mong ma yin pa'i phyir /
translated: Therefore, the consciousnesses of these five sense faculties are taught to be the sense consciousnesses because they are the uncommon dominant conditions of the five sense faculties.

original: de dag nyid kyi rnam par shes par bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /
analyzed: de dag nyid kyi rnam par shes par bstan gyi gzugs la sogs pa'i ni ma yin te /

analyzed: dper na rda bo che'i sgra dang / nas kyi myu gu bzhin no //
translated: just as the sound of a drum is called the sound of a drum and the sprout of barley is called the sprout of barley.

translated: When the eye sees visible form while abiding in the body, are the body, eye, visible form and consciousness all of the same level or not?

original: smras pa / de dag thams cad bye brag yod de 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mig gis rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na thams cad rang gi sa par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: smras pa / de dag thams cad bye brag yod de 'dod pa'i khams su skyes pa'i rang bzhin gyi mig gis rang gi gzugs rnams la lta ba na thams cad rang gi sa par 'gyur ro //
translated: All of them are different. When one born in the desire realm looks at forms of its own level with the eye of its own level, all are of its own level.

original: de nyid rang gi gzugs rnams la bsam gtan dang po'i mig gis lta ba na /
analyzed: de nyid rang gi gzugs rnams la bsam gtan dang po'i mig gis lta ba na /

original: lus dang gzugs ni rang gis pa yin la /
analyzed: lus dang gzugs ni rang gis pa yin la /

original: rnam par shes pa dang mig ni de'i sa ba'i 'o //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang mig ni de'i sa ba'i 'o //

original: bsam gtan dang po dag tu lta ba na gzugs kyang de'i sa pa'i 'o //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang po dag tu lta ba na gzugs kyang de'i sa pa'i 'o //

analyzed: rang gi gzugs rnams la bsam gtan gnyis pa'i mig gis lta ba na /
